sentences.sContent: He became a brigadier general before leaving the military in 1966.
sentences.sContent_eng: He became a brigadier general before leaving the military in 1966.
sentences.sCn: 他的军人生涯升至准将，随后在1966年退伍。

sentences.sContent: It says three army officers, including a brigadier-general, were ambushed and killed on Sunday by armed criminal gangs who then mutilated the bodies with sharp tools.
sentences.sContent_eng: It says three army officers, including a brigadier-general, were ambushed and killed on Sunday by armed criminal gangs who then mutilated the bodies with sharp tools.
sentences.sCn: 据称，周日，武装犯罪团伙伏击了包括一名准将在内的三名陆军军官，并使用利器将他们的尸体砍断。

phrases.pCn: 美国空军或海军陆战队准将

trans.tranOther: a high military rank in the British army, or the person who has this rank
